config_description: /** * Database setting DROP_RESTRICT (default: true) * Whether the default action for DROP TABLE, DROP VIEW, DROP SCHEMA, DROP * DOMAIN, and DROP CONSTRAINT is RESTRICT. */
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code checks the value of 'dropRestrict' in the database settings. If 'dropRestrict' is true, the dropAction is set to ConstraintActionType.RESTRICT, otherwise it is set to ConstraintActionType.CASCADE.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a DROP operation (DROP TABLE, DROP VIEW, DROP SCHEMA, DROP DOMAIN, DROP CONSTRAINT) is performed in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the configuration option is that it determines the default action for DROP operations. If set to true, the default action is RESTRICT, meaning the operation will fail if there are dependencies. If set to false, the default action is CASCADE, meaning the operation will cascade and delete dependent objects.
